newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian lending rate drops to 10.3 from 11.7 pct.
newsitem.headline: Croatian lending rate drops to 10.3 from 11.7 pct.

text.p: The Croatian average lending rate dropped to 10.3 percent on Tuesday from 11.7 percent amid improved liquidity, dealers said.
Banks had to repay some 94 million kuna in four-day repo funds granted them by the central bank at an average 8.58 percent last Friday.
Fresh interbank borrowings totalled 17.1 million and were all call money, mostly at 10.5 percent. The rate was unchanged from Monday after an earlier 50-point drop.
Insurers rolled over five million kuna in previous loans at an unchanged 9.0 percent.
One savings bank also got a renewal for a smaller one-month deal at a steady 17 percent.
The central bank calculated its kuna mid-rates for Wednesday firmer at 6.0294 against the dollar and weaker 3.5772 against the German mark. -- Sandra Kalogjera, Zagreb Newsroom 385-1-4557075
